comments.raw_text:
Feature request:
Display flags in the folders list to show what tags are applied to the messages in it.

Reason:
Make tags more useful by making sure they don't get lost in sub-folders or just off the bottom of the subject list.
(i.e show when a folder contains a message tagged as 'Urgent' etc)

Implementation:
I imagine appropriately coloured flag icons next to the folder name - mouse over the flag to show tag name & number of messages tagged with it.

Flags should include messages in sub folders when a folder is collapsed, but only its immediate contents when expanded.

(In reply to Hashem Masoud from comment #1)
> This can be applied using filters

I can't see how.  Surely that wouldn't do anything with the folders list and would hide untagged messages in the message list.

With messages filtered into about 30 folders I want to see where my tags are without having to go through every folder and filter them or sort by tags.

Here is an example of what I mean.

Each folder shows what tags are used in it and its collapsed sub-folders
I've also shown the same for starred messages.
At a glance you can see where there are tagged or starred messages.

It is nothing to do with saved searches or filtering.
Virtual folders don't do the job - I want to see WHERE the tags are.  Not just the tagged messages.
